cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.HC. 

This paper deals with the evaluation of recommender systems, which is a topic that falls under the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a new metric for measuring surprise in recommendations, which involves exploring the limits of surprise that any algorithm can embed in a recommendation. This idea is related to the fields of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI), which are also likely sub-categories for this paper. The paper also discusses the behaviour of the proposed metric using a dataset, which suggests that it could be relevant to the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI). Finally, the paper's focus on evaluating the effectiveness of recommender systems could also make it relevant to the sub-category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC).
